abstract: HSBC, Britain’s largest bank, said earnings rose 10 percent in the first half of the year, to $14.07 billion, thanks in part to lower charges for bad loans, especially in the United States.
snippet: HSBC, Britain’s largest bank, said earnings rose 10 percent in the first half of the year, to $14.07 billion, thanks in part to lower charges for bad loans, especially in the United States.
lead_paragraph: LONDON – HSBC, Britain’s largest bank, said on Monday that earnings rose 10 percent in the first half of the year, thanks in part to lower charges for bad loans, especially in the United States.
